item.title: Report E-2024100142
item.description:
Report E-2024100142

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-05
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0037 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XLA. It was reported that approximately 5 ounces of V722-D was released from a 12-gallon bladder bag due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer #3117553 at dock door 231. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. 217039-1– 10-gallon metal drum contains a 12-gallon blader bag of V722-D and oil dri. The drum was staged onsite at the terminal personnel for handling.

item.title: Report E-2024100133
item.description:
Report E-2024100133

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-04
  • City: BRIDGEVIEW
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 18:37 EST on 9/4, XPO-XBV contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 1 teaspoon of "NALCO 7341" from a 275-gallon poly tote. The tote had a damaged cap/seal and was prone to spilling in motion. ERTS confirmed the material to be a class 8 corrosive which XPO personnel are not permitted to clean. The contractors impacted and neutralized the NALCO 7341 and containerized waste into (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was placed at the terminal for personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024100222
item.description:
Report X-2024100222

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T12:22:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-25
  • City: HODGKINS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER SENT TO A LEAKING HAZMAT IN OB 3, BAY 525. RESPONDER NOTICED 2 LEAKING AND WET PACKAGES, USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO CONTAINERIZE THE PACKAGES AND CLEAN UP THE SPILLED MATERIAL. PACKAGES AND MATERIAL WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. INFORMATION WAS COLLECTED ON ALL SIX SIDES OF BOTHE PACKAGES, SOME LIQUID WAS SOLIDIFIED, AND ALL MATERIAL WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP. THE PRO0CESSED MATERIAL WAS PLACED IN THE UNCONFIRMED DMP STORAGE AREA UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER DONNED FULL PPE AND HAD DECISION TREE AND SPILL CART. FOLLOWING THE RESPONSE SHEET FOR AN UNKNOWN CONTENTS, DISCOVERED IT WAS A CORROSIVE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL ACCORDING TO THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET PAGE. RESPONDER BROUGHT THE SPILL BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING AND DISCOVERED WHAT WAS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT. CALLED HMSC FOR FURTHER INSTRUCTION.

item.title: Report I-2024090066
item.description:
Report I-2024090066

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-03T09:21:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-12
  • City: Kankakee
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: N&M TRANSFER
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While staged at yard, a leak was detected coming from trailer. Area was isolated and Environmental Restoration LLC was dispatched to perform cleanup. Upon arrival on site, ERLLC applied absorbent material to the free product beneath trailer, and performed trailer inspection. One 55-gallon drum was discovered at nose of trailer, which appeared to be struck by a nail during transit or loading process. ERLLC utilized absorbent material to clean the trailer floor, overpacked the Ieaking drum, and reloaded trailer. Product was scraped from impacted area and containerized with spent absorbent into one 55-gallon drum. Three drums were generated during response. One overpack drum, which contained the damaged drum, one 55-gallon recovery drum with contaminated cardboard, and one 55-gallon drum of spent absorbents, gravel, and poly sheeting. Free product was contained to immediate area and did not threaten to impact state waters. There were no injuries or exposures reported.
